title: Leicester vs Tottenham: Player ratings:
text:
Leicester City demonstrated their top-six credentials by battling back to beat Tottenham Hotspur on Saturday.

The Foxes made a strong start to the match and thought they had taken the lead when Wilfred Ndidi finished from close-range. However, he was clearly offside and VAR ruled out the goal.

Spurs then took the lead when Harry Kane beat Kasper Schmeichel with a fine instinctive finish after he had been tripped in the penalty box.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Tottenham should have had another goal in the second-half when Serge Aurier finished confidently, only for his effort to be controversially ruled out by VAR due to a razor-thin offside call against Son Heung-min.

Leicester then struck twice late on. First Ricardo levelled the score, before James Maddison secured all three points with a fine finish from outside the box. Here is how we rated the two teams.
